intro: Guatteria schomburgkiana var. holosericea, commonly known as the silky guatteria, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically glossy and have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental value. This species is often cultivated in shaded gardens due to its preference for moist, well-drained soil and partial shade.
